SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Include Canonical Links on More Pages

To prevent search engine bots from following multiple paths to the same page and indexing duplicate results, canonical links are now available in more pages. B2B Commerce for Visualforce automatically inserts a canonical link in the <head> of the Home, Product List, and Product Detail pages. B2B Commerce for Visualforce includes all canonical links in the sitemap, which helps a search engine bot find and crawl all of your pages more easily. And, if you’ve set up friendly URLs for products and categories, the canonical link uses your friendly URL values, too.

Where: This change applies to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10) in Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.

Why: Previous versions of B2B Commerce for Visualforce created a canonical link for only the Product Detail page. Also, the canonical link was added only when both of the following conditions were true:

You enabled friendly URLs.
You assigned the product to a category.

Now, B2B Commerce for Visualforce creates a canonical link, regardless of whether you enable friendly URLs or whether you assign a product to a category.

How: B2B Commerce for Visualforce inserts canonical URLs automatically.

The following API changes support this change. If you previously created extensions or overrides, adjust your custom code to account for the changes where necessary.

The ccrz.cc_hk_UserInterface extension point has a new method, canonicalUrlInclude(), which handles returning the URLs for the Home page, Product List page, and Product Detail page.
The ccrz.ccApiProduct.getUrlFor() method includes an additional key in the input map, ccrz.ccApiProduct.PRODUCTSKULIST, that also affects how the ccrz.ccApiProduct.PRODUCTURLMAP key in the output map returns data. The ccrz.ccLogicProductUrlFor class is also updated to handle this processing.
SEE ALSO

(Salesforce Developers) ccrz.ccApiProduct
(Salesforce Developers) ccrz.ccLogicProductUrlFor
